name: Shangqing Zhao
content: Shangqing Zhao's homepage @ University of Oklahoma University of Oklahoma Homepage Research Publications Shangqing Zhao Ph.D., Assistant Professor School of Computer Science University of Oklahoma Norman Campus: 110 W. Boyd St., DEH 210D, Norman, OK 73019 Tulsa Campus: 4502 E 41st St, 4303, Tulsa, OK 74135 Email: shangqing@ou.edu | Phone: (918) 660-3292 Multiple Ph.D. openings are available in our group. Self-motivated students who have strong interests in mobile system design, network security, wireless security, IoT design, machine learning, are always welcome to join us. Short Bio Shangqing Zhao is an Assistant Professor in School of Computer Science, University of Oklahoma. He received his Ph.D. degree under Dr. Zhuo Lu at University of South Florida in 2021. Shangqing Zhao's research primarily focuses on the network and mobile system design and security. His research results have been published in top-tier conferences and journals. He also served as a reviewer for multiple top academic journals and conferences. News [Dec 2024] Our paper on RFID attack has been accepcted by INFOCOM 2025 [Apr 2024] Our proposal on Capsule Forensics has been funded by OU DISC. Thanks DISC! [Dec 2023] Our paper on defending adversary machine learning on spectrum attack has been accepcted by INFOCOM 2024 [Oct 2023] Our proposal on adversal driven physical layer security has been funded by NSF SaTC. Thanks to NSF! [Aug 2023] Our education proposal on AI related 5G security has been funded by NSF. Thanks to NSF! [Aug 2023] Our paper on the efficient attacks of physical layer authentication has been accepted by IEEE S&P 2024. [July 2023] Our paper on adaptive mmWave AP design won IEEE ICCCN 2023 Best Paper Award.
